revised_title: Secular Changes in Tidal Distortion and Satellite Orbits
tldr: This article investigates the effects of tidal friction on the orbits of satellites around tidally distorted planets. The author, G. H. Darwin, explores the secular changes in the elements of a satellite's orbit, including inclination, mean distance, and eccentricity, due to the planet's viscosity and the presence of a second disturbing body. The findings have implications for understanding the history of the Earth and the Moon.
